title: How do I implement a binary search algorithm?
content: I'm struggling to understand how binary search works. Can someone explain it to me?

replies.reply: Sure! Binary search works by dividing the array in half and checking if the middle element is the target. If not, it decides which half to search next based on whether the target is greater or less than the middle element.
I found a great video on YouTube that explains it step by step!
Binary search is really efficient for large datasets!
Make sure your array is sorted before using binary search.
Remember binary search has a O(logn) time complexity!

title: What is the difference between let and var in JavaScript?
content: I often see both let and var used in JavaScript code. What's the difference?

replies.reply: The main difference is scope. 'var' is function-scoped, while 'let' is block-scoped. This means 'let' is more predictable and safer to use in modern JavaScript.
I think 'let' is better for most cases because it avoids some common bugs.
'var' can lead to unexpected behavior due to hoisting.
I always use 'let' and 'const' in my projects now.
I don't know the difference tbh
I usually use 'const' in my JavaScript projects

title: How can I center a div in CSS?
content: I'm trying to center a div both vertically and horizontally. What's the best way to do this?

replies.reply: You can use flexbox to center a div easily. Set the parent container to 'display: flex', and use 'justify-content: center' and 'align-items: center'.
